summary: Netflix-like web app that provides movie recap scripts instead of streaming videos. UI/UX should replicate Netflix's interface and flow exactly.
architectural_notes: Frontend should closely mirror Netflix's visual design language and user experience patterns
Movie data structure needs title, thumbnail, categories, and recap script content
Consider row-based layout with horizontal scrolling like Netflix browse interface
known_issues: Blank black screen on deployment - requires proper initialization and error boundaries
CSP (Content Security Policy) error causing 'disallowed origin' on Internet Computer deployment

existing_features.title: Create a homepage with a Netflix-inspired hero section featuring a prominent movie recap with title, description, and call-to-action button
Implement horizontal scrollable rows of movie cards organized by categories (e.g., 'Trending Recaps', 'Action Movies', 'Drama', 'Comedy')
Create a top navigation bar with logo, browse menu, search icon, and user profile section matching Netflix's navigation design
Build a movie detail page that displays the full recap script in a readable format with movie metadata (title, genre, year, duration)
Implement search functionality that filters movies by title and displays results in a grid layout similar to Netflix search results
Add a 'My List' feature allowing users to save movie recaps for later reading with persistent storage
Implement responsive design that adapts the Netflix-style layout for mobile, tablet, and desktop screens
Apply a cohesive dark theme visual design inspired by Netflix's aesthetic including color palette (deep blacks, reds for accents), typography hierarchy, and spacing patterns
Add loading states and error boundaries to the root App component to catch and display rendering errors instead of showing a blank screen
Add fallback loading states to HomePage component that display a skeleton UI while movie data is being fetched from the backend
Ensure the HomePage component properly handles the case when no movies exist by displaying the hero section with the first seeded movie immediately after seeding completes
Add comprehensive error handling to all React Query hooks (useQueries.ts) to log errors to console and provide fallback empty states instead of failing silently
Add console logging to the main.tsx entry point and HomePage component to track application initialization flow and identify where rendering might be failing

new_feature_requests.summary: Movie detail pages showing recap scripts
Responsive design matching Netflix UI/UX patterns
Create a backend data model to store movie information including title, genre, year, poster image URL, backdrop image URL, and recap script text
Seed the backend with sample movie data including titles, metadata, and recap scripts for at least 20 movies across multiple genres
Verify the backend main.mo actor properly initializes with stable storage and returns valid responses for getAllMovies and searchMovies queries
Ensure the Internet Identity authentication flow properly initializes and does not block rendering of public movie content on the homepage
